column4: Yesterday I changed my network driver fram rt61pci to rt61 and works great now. But now I do not get Mongrel to work. No brower respond to the http://0.0.0.0:3000 anymore.. Anyone knows why?
http://0.0.0.0:3000 should never have worked in the first place, does http://127.0.0.1:3000 work?
nope
it says that: ** Starting Mongrel listening at 0.0.0.0:3000, so it should work.. It did work..
i'm assuming mongrel is a network service here .. is it even running? do you have anything listening on port 3000?
kinda new to linux world, but is there a cmd to check what is listening on diffrent ports?
ps aux | grep -i mongrel; netstat -antp | grep -i :3000
hmm, looks good so far .. what does this give you?  http://localhost:3000
it just hangs...
it could be that mongrel or ruby have a problem .. does mongrel have any logfiles you can examine?
you could also try this?   wget http://localhost:3000
ok two secs
Connecting to localhost|127.0.0.1|:3000...  (just hangs there)
doesnt seem to be anything in the log file either
try restarting mongrel (i don't know how that is done) .. see if that helps somehow
nope.. hehe nothing works.. so wierd.. all this happend after i changed the network driver..
i'm not sure this is a problem with the network driver but i also don't know enough about mongrel (first time i am hearing of it) to troubleshoot the service ..
mongrel is another webserver like webrick, if you ever heard of that?
not really :) not much into ruby and it's extensions, i gathered it was a webserver
hehe ok ;-) hmm well thx anyway =)
